message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.CY, cs.DS 

The paper discusses the security and communication models of Zero-Interaction based Co-presence Detection and Authentication (ZICDA) systems, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also reviews the state-of-the-art proximity verification techniques that make use of contextual information, which can be considered as a subfield of signal processing (cs.SI) and information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the challenges and possible future solutions for detecting co-presence between devices, which can be related to the fields of cyber-physical systems (cs.CY) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
